comments.commentBody:
Someone needs to ask Donald Trump what books have informed his view of world history and the American political process. Let me guess. This guy doesn't have the attention span to read a 40 page position page. I'm sure a Reader's Digest abbreviated version would be way past this ignoramus.

Oh, I forgot, he's got a very good brain and he watches the Sunday morning talk shows. This narcissistic ignoramus is a threat to the Republic. Hopefully, he will destroy the Republican Party in its current incarnation.

Trump will be responsible for a very Liberal Supreme Court, higher taxes to rebuild our infrastructure, single payer, a fix for Social Security, a reversal of Citizens United, and handgun control. There is a new horizon of hope for America when the old White racists are divided and conquered!

Minority majority can't come too soon...

Cruz shows he is smart. Misdirected Kasich by collaboration and threw off the press while readying the VP pick announcement on the day Trump made major foreign policy speech. Very crafty. Worthy of the Cruz smirk.
Crafty people don't earn friends. Their tactics are scary but not ones that build trust. Cruz looks smart and slimy. He has derailed press coverage for Trump. Is it enough to win him Indiana to stop Trump?

Sorry, but as a life long Registered Republican...
I will not vote for Trump, a racist and hate monger.

Shame on the GOP who stood by silently while:
- Trump mocked a disabled man.
- Played footsie with the KKK ( partly due to the fact that Trump's new found registered voters are White Supremacists )
- Denigrated a reporter for asking a tough question ( actually just using Trump's own actual language back to Trump) and stating about Ms. Kelly that she was menstruating. "blood coming out of her whatever".
- Tweeting a picture of Heidi Cruz late at night ( and never apologizing to Ms. Cruz).
- Offering to pay for one of his supporter's legal bills for sucker punching a protestor.
- Threatening violence ( wink/wink my supporters and the plans on the internet to disrupt the convention if he doesn't get the nomination) are as awful as posting hotel rooms of delegates ( oh, thanks to Mr. Stone for planting that idea into the zombie Trumpets' minds too).
The list goes on and on...

Even just one of the above examples would have been enough for anyone who respects our constitution to say:

"Enough Mr. Trump, run as an independent. You are a disgrace and do not represent our Republican values".

God speed to Cruz and Kasich...
Please save our party.

replies.commentBody:
Dear Steve,
No offense, but you don't have the full picture from across the pond. Trump is a failed businessman, he owns half of what his daddy gave him 25 years ago, and has had four bankruptcies. He's cheated on all of his wives and he lies all the time (accidentally telling the truth approximately 9% of the time, as analyzed). He has no understanding of foreign policy, the military, the economy, diplomacy, negotiation, history, geography, or domestic issues.

Trump is a total buffoon, in addition to being racist, sexist, fascist, and a belligerent ignoramus. So the worst possible thing America would do would be electing him. And really, you should pray that we don't elect him too, as he is quite likely to start a nuclear war, through bullying and fumbling, and Europe would burn in radioactive fire if we do.

comments.commentBody:
I've been watching Trump from the UK from the minute he announced he was running, and my thoughts last year were this:

He will go all the way, and will be up against Clinton at the end.
Everything will be done to stop him and the people from choosing him.
It will be entertaining.
A businessman is exactly what the country needs, and it will also help the rest of the world including us here in the UK.

Well now he is so close to being up against Clinton and the usual suspects, and I have my fingers crossed that he will beat her. In the UK, every single person I speak to tells me that they don't want Trump to win, and one of the biggest reasons is that if you view the UK news articles, very rarely will you ever find an article in his favour, such is the reach of Clintons mob. But I log onto to all the US news channels and online news sites, and I am also not stupid.

The people who need help right now, need Trump right now. They really do, he is truly your last best hope for truly fantastic future. Please America, for the rest of the world and yourselves, VOTE TRUMP!

I love listening to all the media acolytes scrambling to CYA and try to make it seem like they saw this coming months off. We the People have spoken, and those words are Trump 2016! Make America Great Again!

That t-shirt on the left. Absolutely hilarious.

Where can I get one?

An incredible campaign, even this far, when you see how the system works and how hard it is to break in.
I have some reservations re Trump but generally think -- let's give him a chance. He has demonstrated uncanny skills throughout his political rise that if applied to US & world issues just might work.
My instincts say he is sincere in his patriotism and I'd like to believe he'd rise to the occasion as often happens with the presidency.

I think it's pretty clear that Trump will get the GOP nomination no matter what, with no brokered convention possible. Cruz keeps shooting himself in the foot (eg: picking Fiorina), Kasich never had a chance (too sane), and the GOP tends to move in lock-step formation at all times.

So now that Trump will be the nominee, we must consider how, as a nation, to stop him. Stop him here and he should cease to be a threat forever more, the failure will destroy him. If we don't stop him, then our country is doomed.

Trump has never needed anywhere near the delegates that people have claimed. There are still a lot of other unpledged delegates (North Dakota, Colorado and Wyoming for example) that Trump could pick off. We know the Cruz campaign's claims about having won these are dubious at best

But the fundamental thing remains- Cruz has no credible path to blocking Trump. Cruz was collapsing as his insider game was exposed. Trump surged in that time and was leading Indiana before hand anyway. A Trump romp is almost a given

The media made a presumption based on little evidence that Nebraska, Montana and South Dakota would go against Trump when every sign points to a Trump victory in all of them
We are slicing and dicing delegates here but the basic fact remains: Trump is the clear choice of Republican primary voters and is the only logical nominee.

The stakes in this election became huge with the resumption of the great American Bathroom War in North Carolina.  Today, they became cosmic with former speaker Boehner's revelation that Lyin Ted Cruz is in fact the anti-christ. Victory by  the Donald aka Trump I is essential.

Indiana is important in the perception of jobs. The gutting of the American economy in the way of the exiting Carrier Air Conditioning Co.,Trump has been voluminously decrying is as a focal point. Winning Indiana will boost the very important message that Tump's economic message has hit home to the America people. It is very important that Trump shows a win and then…go forward to cement the nomination without question.

replies.commentBody: Personally, I hope to see Texas primary his butt back to Canada. We the People have had enough with the backroom deals ruining this country. It's time to Put America First and Make her Great Again!
I understand that if Cruz loses in Indiana, he plans on announcing his Cabinet choices.

comments.commentBody: The Republican race is over, done.  The Cubanadian ended it when he took the desperate move of naming a running mate even though he's in a distant second place. Even worse, his choice is one of the most hated people in California, who got creamed in a Senate election here not long ago. She even further torpedoed him with her cringe inducing singing at the announcement... what was THAT? He should have been making a concession speech not a running mate announcement. This race and his Quixotic refusal to concede will come back to haunt him.

replies.commentBody:
Dear Neil,
Likely not, as with the primaries almost over, Trump has gotten about 10 million votes so far. Previous candidates have done far better, and as that's about 1/12th of the people expected to vote in the general election, Trump is nearly certain to lose in November.

comments.commentBody: WOW!! Donald Trump will likely wind up winning the most primary votes of any GOP presidential candidate in modern history...

Trump's "message" about Carrier Corp plays well in Indiana, so I am one curious Hoosier to see how this primary's going to go. The first presidential primary yard sign I saw, of any party, was for Ted Cruz many many months ago. But that was at a house that frequently displays signage such as "Christian children Need Christian Education," and (right after Obama's reelection) "O America What Have You Done?"

Hoosiers other than fundamentalists will be irritated by Cruz's blatant manipulations like the Kasich tactic (what was that all about, remind me?) and the VP stunt.

Although it's utterly trivial, Cruz's stupid little basketball gaffe shows what a phony he is. It's so Mellie Grant at Gettysburger. I'm not at all a sports fan, and Trump and Bobby Knight are a match made in somebody's heaven other than mine, but how culturally illiterate do you have to be not to know it's "shooting hoops" not "shooting rings," or "rim" not "ring" from the phrase "rim shot"?

Governor Mike Pence has his own negatives (one of the most commonly seen yard signs around here is "Fire Mike Pence") and is wise to keep his distance from any of the candidates. The National Review doesn't know what it's talking about (http://www.nationalreview.com/article/434572/mike-pence-ted-cruz-endorse... Pence is virtually tied with his Democratic challenger, the affable bespectacled walrus-mustachioed John Gregg, and Hoosiers aren't afraid to vote for a Dem when unhappy with the GOP.
They constantly talk about how Trump has a problem with women and millennials, yet every time I see a snapshot of his supporters, I see either women or people who are obviously under 30.
Damon Winter should get a prize and a raise for that photo.  It captures Trump support better than anything I've seen.

replies.commentBody: You didn't use the sarcasm font.
:) The are just not getting your sarcasm, so just take it that these replies agree with you :) God bless their cotton socks.
I see what you did there... ;-)

comments.commentBody: Trump better watch out!  Now that Cruz has Carly Fiorina on the ticket, Cruz is poised to sweep - nay, decimate - poor Donald in California. Californians love Carly Fiorina!  And Kasich, that wily tiger, he's out there ready to suck up, who knows, 2 maybe even 3 percent of the votes in the upcoming primaries.  Ooooh, Donald,  you better stay on your toes!

replies.commentBody:
Dear Programmer,
Sorry but you're incorrect. Trump has gotten 10 million votes so far, and in the last presidential election, 125 million people voted. Most educated people, and most minorities, and most women, do not support the racist, sexist, fascist ignoramus, for obvious reasons. He'll get the GOP nomination but he cannot win the general election. Thank god, because his bumbling incompetence and belligerence would destroy our nation.

He is on track to get by far the most votes ever in a GOP nomination. And that is with 17 candidates in the race, the establishment and media against him. Comparing a general to a primary is apples and oranges.

comments.commentBody: All recent polls have underestimated Mr Trump's support. This has to be embarrassing for the pollsters. So if you adjust for the persistent negative bias, Trump will surely exceed expectation in coming contests.

replies.commentBody: Thanks for pointing out how bias exists in photos too.  If you seek out other sources, you will see plenty of women and children among his supporters.  Blacks and Hispanics too.
Here's a good sample: https://vimeo.com/153723787
What strikes me is the extraordinary number of blondes at his rallies. It's true.

comments.commentBody: Great accompanying photo. When I picture Trump supporters, these are the men who come to mind.
Democrats continue to dismiss him at their peril.
